parts.text: {"word":"overrule","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(決定・判決など)を覆す、無効にする、否決する","english_definition":"to reject or disallow by exercising one's superior authority.","examples":[{"sentence":"The judge overruled the objection.","translation":"裁判官は異議を却下した。"},{"sentence":"The Supreme Court overruled the lower court's decision.","translation":"最高裁判所は下級裁判所の判決を覆した。"},{"sentence":"The president overruled the committee's recommendation.","translation":"大統領は委員会の勧告を否決した。"}],"collocations":["overrule a decision (決定を覆す)","overrule an objection (異議を却下する)","overrule a ruling (判決を覆す)","overrule a veto (拒否権を覆す)"],"synonyms":["reverse","override","repeal","rescind","invalidate","nullify","set aside","quash"],"antonyms":["uphold","affirm","endorse","sustain","validate"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(感情・考えなど)を抑える、圧倒する","english_definition":"to dominate or prevail over (someone's feelings or thoughts).","examples":[{"sentence":"His desire for revenge was overruled by his sense of justice.","translation":"彼の復讐心は正義感によって抑えられた。"},{"sentence":"She tried to overrule her doubts and go ahead with the plan.","translation":"彼女は疑念を抑えて計画を進めようとした。"}],"collocations":["overrule one's emotions (感情を抑える)","overrule one's doubts (疑念を抑える)","overrule one's fears (恐怖心を抑える)"],"synonyms":["suppress","subdue","repress","dominate","control","master"],"antonyms":["yield to","succumb to","give in to"]}],"etymology":{"value":"「over-」 (上に、超えて) + 「rule」 (支配する、統治する) から構成される。元々は「支配する以上に支配する」という意味合いで、そこから「上位の権限で下位の決定を覆す」という意味に発展した。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌoʊvərˈruːl/","syllables":"o-ver-rule"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["overrule","overrules"],"past_simple":"overruled","past_participle":"overruled","present_participle":"overruling"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**overrule**」は、主に法的な文脈や組織内での意思決定において、上位の権限を持つ者が下位の決定を覆す場合に使われます。裁判所が下級裁判所の判決を覆す、組織のトップが委員会の決定を覆す、といった状況が典型例です。感情や考えを抑えるという意味でも使われますが、この用法は比較的まれです。","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The manager overruled to the employee's suggestion.","correct":"✓ The manager overruled the employee's suggestion.","note":"「overrule」は他動詞なので、目的語を直接取ります。「to」は不要です。"},{"incorrect":"✗ He was overruled by his feelings.","correct":"✓ His feelings overruled him. / ✓ He overruled his feelings.","note":"「overrule」の主語は、決定を覆す主体（人や組織）である必要があります。感情が人を「overrule」する場合は、「His feelings overruled him.」のように、感情が主語になります。または、「He overruled his feelings.」のように、人が感情を抑えるという意味で使うこともできます。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["overruling (名詞: 覆すこと、却下)"],"phrasal_verbs":[],"related_terms":["override (動詞: 優先する、覆す)","reverse (動詞: 逆転させる、覆す)","repeal (動詞: 廃止する)","rescind (動詞: 取り消す)","uphold (動詞: 支持する、維持する)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1","frequency_google_ngram":"比較的低頻度 (Relatively low frequency) - 専門的な語彙。","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"「**overrule**」は、主に法律や組織の決定において、上位の権限を持つ者が下位の決定を覆すことを意味する単語です。例えば、裁判官が異議を「overrule」したり、最高裁判所が下級裁判所の判決を「overrule」したりします。また、感情や考えを抑えるという意味でも使われますが、一般的ではありません。法律やビジネスの文脈でよく使われるため、やや専門的な語彙と言えます。","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The board of directors can **overrule** the CEO's decision.","translation":"取締役会はCEOの決定を覆すことができる。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"覆す (決定)"},{"sentence":"The judge **overruled** the lawyer's objection during the trial.","translation":"裁判官は裁判中に弁護士の異議を却下した。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"却下する (異議)"},{"sentence":"She tried to **overrule** her fear and speak in public.","translation":"彼女は恐怖心を抑えて公の場で話そうとした。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"抑える (感情)"}]}
